main.docTitle: Census and Statistics (Labour Earnings Survey) Order

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Order, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: business undertaking (業務經營) means an undertaking carrying on business in Hong Kong, including profit-making bodies, non-profit-making bodies and statutory bodies;
survey period (調查期) means the survey period specified under section 6.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Survey of payroll and wages
section.content: The Commissioner shall carry out a statistical survey on the expiration of each survey period in respect of business undertakings for the purpose of compiling statistics relating to payroll and wages in the survey period.

subsection.content: For the purpose of a survey, the Commissioner may require a person referred to in section 5 to give information in respect of the matters specified in the Schedule for the survey period covered by the survey.

subsection.leadIn: That person shall give the information to the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by completing such schedule as the Commissioner may issue for that purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within such period as the Commissioner may specify in that schedule.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Persons required to give information
section.leadIn: The person required to give information under section 4 is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the business undertaking being a body corporate, a director, secretary or other person concerned in the management of the body corporate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of the business undertaking being a partnership, any partner of the partnership;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case, the proprietor of the business undertaking.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Survey period
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Order, the survey periods are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for collecting information in relation to wages, March, June, September and December each year beginning from 2000;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for collecting information in relation to payroll, each period of 3 consecutive months beginning from the first 3 months of 2000.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Sampling methods may be used
section.content: The Commissioner may use sampling methods to collect information for the purpose of a survey.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Application of Order in certain cases
section.content: This Order applies to a business undertaking for the purpose of a survey notwithstanding that it commenced business or ceased to carry on business during the survey period covered by the survey.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Date for destruction of completed schedules
section.content: The Commissioner shall destroy all completed schedules collected or received for a survey and all copies of the schedules not later than 24 months after the end of the survey period covered by that survey.

schedule.name: sch0
schedule.heading: Matters in respect of which Information is to be Given

section.name: s1
section.content: Name and address of the business undertaking

section.name: s4
section.content: Number of persons engaged and payroll outlays

section.name: s5
section.content: Reasons for significant changes in the number of persons engaged and payroll outlays

section.name: s6
section.content: Number of standard working days per month and number of normal working hours per working day

section.name: s7
section.content: Number of employees, by selected occupation and by sex

section.name: s8
section.content: Wage information of selected occupations, by sex and by wage component

section.name: s9
section.content: Number of employees entitled to any fringe benefit
